userName.name: What should OpenCode call you?
userName.desc: Your name for personalized greetings (leave empty for generic greetings)

excludedTags.name: Excluded tags
excludedTags.desc: Notes with these tags will not auto-load as context (one per line, without #)

mediaFolder.name: Media folder
mediaFolder.desc: Folder containing attachments/images. When notes use ![[image.jpg]], OpenCode will look here. Leave empty for vault root.

systemPrompt.name: Custom system prompt
systemPrompt.desc: Additional instructions appended to the default system prompt

autoTitle.name: Auto-generate conversation titles
autoTitle.desc: Automatically generate conversation titles after the first exchange.

titleModel.name: Title generation model
titleModel.desc: Model used for auto-generating conversation titles.

navMappings.name: Vim-style navigation mappings
navMappings.desc: One mapping per line. Format: "map <key> <action>" (actions: scrollUp, scrollDown, focusInput).

inlineEditHotkey.name: Inline edit hotkey
inlineEditHotkey.descNoKey: No hotkey set. Click to configure.

openChatHotkey.name: Open chat hotkey
openChatHotkey.descNoKey: No hotkey set. Click to configure.

newTabHotkey.name: New tab hotkey
newTabHotkey.descNoKey: No hotkey set. Click to configure.

newSessionHotkey.name: New session hotkey
newSessionHotkey.descNoKey: No hotkey set. Click to configure.

closeTabHotkey.name: Close tab hotkey
closeTabHotkey.descNoKey: No hotkey set. Click to configure.

slashCommands.name: Slash Commands
slashCommands.desc: Create custom prompt templates triggered by /command. Use $ARGUMENTS for all arguments, $1/$2 for positional args, @file for file content, and !`bash` for command output.

mcpServers.name: MCP Servers
mcpServers.desc: Configure Model Context Protocol servers to extend OpenCode's capabilities with external tools and data sources. Servers with context-saving mode require @mention to activate.

plugins.name: OpenCode Plugins
plugins.desc: Enable or disable plugins discovered from the current backend. Enabled state is saved in Vault settings.

loadUserSettings.name: Load user Claude settings
loadUserSettings.desc: Load ~/.claude/settings.json. When enabled, user's Claude Code permission rules may bypass Safe mode.

blockedCommands.name: Blocked commands ({platform})
blockedCommands.desc: Patterns to block on {platform} (one per line). Supports regex.
blockedCommands.unixDesc: Unix patterns also blocked on Windows because Git Bash can invoke them.

exportPaths.name: Allowed export paths
exportPaths.desc: Paths outside the vault where files can be exported (one per line). Supports ~ for home directory.

customVariables.name: Custom variables
customVariables.desc: Environment variables for Claude SDK (KEY=VALUE format, one per line)

agentBackend.name: Agent backend
agentBackend.desc: Choose which agent backend to use. OpenCode is recommended for local development. Claude Code is available as an alternative.

opencodeHostname.name: OpenCode hostname
opencodeHostname.desc: Hostname where OpenCode server is running (default: 127.0.0.1)

opencodePort.name: OpenCode port
opencodePort.desc: Port where OpenCode server is running (default: 4096)

opencodeTimeout.name: OpenCode timeout
opencodeTimeout.desc: Timeout in milliseconds for OpenCode API requests (default: 5000)

show1MModel.name: Enable extended context model
show1MModel.desc: Enable models with extended context windows in the model selector.

maxTabs.name: Maximum chat tabs
maxTabs.desc: Maximum number of concurrent chat tabs (3-10). Each tab uses a separate session.
maxTabs.warning: More than 5 tabs may impact performance and memory usage.

cliPath.name: CLI path
cliPath.desc: Custom path to CLI. Leave empty for auto-detection.
cliPath.descWindows: For the native installer, use the executable. For npm/pnpm/yarn installs, use the cli.js path.
cliPath.descUnix: Paste the output of "which <cli>" — works for both native and npm/pnpm/yarn installs.

validation.isDirectory: Path is a directory, not a file

language.name: Language
language.desc: Change the display language of the plugin interface
